message.content: To answer this question, we need to understand that molecules are made up of atoms and most physical objects are made up of molecules. Option (A) states that a speech lacks molecules. A speech is a form of communication and does not have a physical presence. It consists of words and ideas, which do not have molecules. Option (B) is incorrect because a dog, like any living organism, is made up of molecules. Option (C) is also incorrect because a book is made up of paper, ink, and other materials that are composed of molecules. Option (D) is incorrect because a grape is a living organism and is made up of molecules.

To determine which of the options lacks molecules, we can think about the nature of each item. Option (A) is a speech, which is a verbal communication. Speeches are made up of sound waves and do not have molecules. Option (B) is a dog, which is a living organism made up of cells that contain molecules. Option (C) is a book, which is made up of paper and ink, both of which are composed of molecules. Option (D) is a grape, which is a fruit made up of cells that contain molecules. Therefore, the correct answer is (A) a speech.

This question requires basic knowledge about the composition of different objects. Molecules are made up of atoms, and objects without atoms would lack molecules. Option (A) is correct because a speech is not a physical object and does not have molecules. Option (B) is incorrect because a dog is a living organism made up of molecules. Option (C) is incorrect because a book is made up of paper, ink, and other materials that have molecules. Option (D) is incorrect because a grape is a fruit made up of cells, which are made up of molecules.

This question requires basic scientific knowledge about the composition of matter. Molecules are made up of atoms, and not all objects or substances contain molecules. Option (A) is correct because a speech is a collection of words and ideas communicated through language, which does not have a physical form and therefore does not contain molecules. Options (B), (C), and (D) are incorrect because dogs, books, and grapes are all made up of matter and therefore contain molecules.

A book is made up of molecules as well, as it is composed of paper and ink which are made up of atoms. A speech, however, is a collection of spoken words and does not have a physical form. Therefore, it does not contain molecules.

This question is asking us to identify which item lacks molecules. A molecule is a group of atoms bonded together, so we need to determine which item is not made up of atoms bonded together.

Option (A) is a speech, which is a form of communication consisting of words and sentences. Speech is not a physical object and is made up of sounds produced by the vocal cords. It does not have a molecular structure, so it lacks molecules.

Option (B) is a dog, which is a living organism made up of cells. Cells are composed of molecules, so a dog does have molecules.

Option (C) is a book, which is a physical object made up of paper and ink. Both paper and ink are made up of atoms bonded together, so a book has molecules.

Option (D) is a grape, which is a fruit composed of cells. Like the dog, a grape is made up of cells that contain molecules.

Therefore, the correct answer is (A) a speech, as it lacks molecules compared to the other options.
